perturbation.original_text:
28. Law and jurisdiction
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in all respects in accordance with the law of England and Wales and both parties
submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts.
perturbation.changed_text:
28. Law and jurisdiction
This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in all respects in accordance with the law of England and Wales, unless both parties mutually agree on an alternative jurisdiction. Both parties submit to the jurisdiction of the English Courts, provided an alternative legal venue has not been selected at the time of disagreement.
perturbation.explanation: The clause originally mandates that the contract is governed and construed in accordance with the law of England and Wales, submitting both parties to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. The alteration introduces uncertainty by allowing both parties to 'mutually agree on an alternative jurisdiction' and states that 'both parties submit to the jurisdiction of the English Courts, provided an alternative legal venue has not been selected at the time of disagreement'. This contradicts the initial, exclusive agreement to English law and jurisdiction, thus introducing a legal contradiction regarding the legal framework applicable to the contract and reduces enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
16. Termination
16.1 Following expiry of the initial period described in Clause 15 above, DCL or SEV giving not less than six months notice in
writing may terminate this Agreement. In addition, DCL may terminate this Agreement with effect from the 3rd, 4th or 5th
anniversary of the Commencement Date by giving not less than six months notice in writing to SEV. During the notice
period, all Clauses and provisions of this Agreement shall remain in effect. Any defects in Vehicles notified to SEV by DCL
during the notice period shall be remedied prior to the end of this Agreement. If Schedule One has expired during the
notice period then all Maintenance Charges and Additional Charges shall be charged at the rates shown in the last
effective Schedule One increased in line with the last published Retail Price Index.
perturbation.changed_text:
16. Termination
16.1 Following expiry of the initial period described in Clause 15 above, DCL or SEV giving not less than six months notice in
writing may terminate this Agreement. In addition, DCL may terminate this Agreement with effect from the 3rd, 4th or 5th
anniversary of the Commencement Date by giving not less than six months notice in writing to SEV, unless otherwise determined by internal business affairs. During the notice
period, all Clauses and provisions of this Agreement shall remain in effect, except for cases of gross misconduct or termination after mutual agreement. Any defects in Vehicles notified to SEV by DCL
during the notice period shall be remedied prior to the end of this Agreement, however, SEV will not be liable to make those fixes. If Schedule One has expired during the
notice period then all Maintenance Charges and Additional Charges shall be charged at the discretion of the parties involved.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause establishes a clear process for termination, requiring six months' notice and specifying conditions under which DCL can terminate. The modification introduces several contradictions. It allows termination 'unless otherwise determined by internal business affairs', creating ambiguity about the initial notice period. It also states that all clauses remain in effect 'except for cases of gross misconduct or termination after mutual agreement', which contradicts the overall continuation of the agreement. Furthermore, stating that 'SEV will not be liable to make those fixes' creates contradiction with the clause, which indicates the necessity to fix it 'prior to the end of this agreement' and charging maintenance charges at 'the discretion of the parties involved', which conflicts with the original clause mandating the rates of the last effective schedule.

perturbation.original_text:
13. Warranties and Liability
13.6 SEV's entire liability in respect of the sums payable pursuant to the indemnities contained in Clauses 13.4 and 13.5 shall be
limited to the annualised value of the Maintenance Charges calculated on the Commencement Date or the last anniversary
thereof, unless SEV is insured in respect of such liability, in which case SEV's liability under Clauses 13.4 and 13.5 shall be
limited to the extent of such cover.
perturbation.changed_text:
13. Warranties and Liability
13.6 SEV's entire liability in respect of the sums payable pursuant to the indemnities contained in Clauses 13.4 and 13.5 shall be
limited to the annualised value of the Maintenance Charges calculated on the Commencement Date or the last anniversary
thereof, however, this clause is voided if SEV deems at fault. If SEV is insured in respect of such liability, clauses 13.4 and 13.5 do not apply; any further cases will be solved as appropriate.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause limits SEV's liability to the annualized value of maintenance charges, with an exception based on insurance coverage. The modification introduces a contradiction by stating 'however, this clause is voided if SEV deems at fault', giving SEV the power to unilaterally negate the liability limit, which is inconsistent and lacks clarity. Additionally, 'If SEV is insured in respect of such liability, clauses 13.4 and 13.5 do not apply; any further cases will be solved as appropriate' introduces an undefined method of 'solving cases', and creates ambiguity as it removes liability.
